alert.note: Alert for Crow Wing; North Cass; South Cass (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 5:09AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Cass and western Crow Wing Counties through 545 AM CDT... At 508 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles south of Huntersville, to 7 miles west of Leader, to near Motley, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Brainerd, Baxter, Breezy Point, Pequot Lakes, Nisswa, Pine River, Pillager, Backus, Poplar, Fort Ripley, Leader, Gull Lake, Saint Mathias, Sylvan, Lake Shore, East Gull Lake, St. Mathias, Oshawa, Jenkins, and Chickamaw Beach. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive through flood waters.

area.areaDesc: Crow Wing; North Cass; South Cass
